versions.label: Introduced
versions.raw_html:
The following has special meaning:
green underline denotes added text
red struck out text denotes deleted text
2025 IL H 1859
Author: Rashid
Version: Introduced
Version Date: 01/29/2025

104TH GENERAL ASSEMBLY

State of Illinois

2025 and 2026

HB1859

Introduced 1/29/2025, by Rep. Abdelnasser Rashid

SYNOPSIS AS INTRODUCED:

110 ILCS 805/3-29.28 new

Amends the Public Community College Act. Provides that the board of trustees of a community college district shall require the primary instructor of a course to meet specified qualifications set forth in the Illinois Administrative Code and any other applicable rules adopted by the Illinois Community College Board. Provides that a course may not, in lieu of a primary instructor, use artificial intelligence or a generative artificial intelligence program.

STATE MANDATES ACT MAY REQUIRE REIMBURSEMENT

MAY APPLY

A BILL FOR

AN ACT concerning education.

Be it enacted by the People of the State of Illinois, represented in the General Assembly:

Section 5. The Public Community College Act is amended by adding Section 3-29.28 as follows:

(110 ILCS 805/3-29.28 new)

Sec. 3-29.28. Primary instructor qualifications. Each board shall require the primary instructor of a course to be an individual who meets the qualifications set forth in 23 Ill. Adm. Code 1501.303(f) and any other applicable rules adopted by the State Board. A course may not, in lieu of a primary instructor, use artificial intelligence or a generative artificial intelligence program, as defined in Section 2-101 of the Illinois Human Rights Act.

110 ILCS 805/3-29.28 new

Amends the Public Community College Act. Provides that the board of trustees
of a community college district shall require the primary instructor of a
course to meet specified qualifications set forth in the Illinois

Community College Board. Provides that a course may not, in lieu of a primary

STATE MANDATES ACT MAY REQUIRE REIMBURSEMENT

versions.label: Enrolled
versions.raw_html:
The following has special meaning:
green underline denotes added text
red struck out text denotes deleted text
2025 IL H 1859
Author: Rashid
Version: Enrolled
Version Date: 05/30/2025

HB1859 Enrolled

AN ACT concerning education.

Be it enacted by the People of the State of Illinois, represented in the General Assembly:

Section 5. The Public Community College Act is amended by adding Section 3-29.28 as follows:

(110 ILCS 805/3-29.28 new)

Sec. 3-29.28. Use of artificial intelligence in instruction.

(a) As used in this Section, "artificial intelligence" has the same meaning given to the term in Section 2-101 of the Illinois Human Rights Act.

(b) Each board shall require the faculty member who teaches a course to be an individual who meets the qualifications set forth in 23 Ill. Adm. Code 1501.303(f) and any other applicable rules adopted by the State Board. A course may not, in lieu of a faculty member, use artificial intelligence as the sole source of instruction for students.

(c) Nothing in this Section shall be construed to prohibit a faculty member from using artificial intelligence to augment course instruction.


Copyright © 2025 State Net

HB1859 Enrolled

AN ACT concerning education.

**Be it enacted by the People of the State of Illinois, represented in the
General Assembly:**

Section 5. The Public Community College Act is amended by adding Section
3-29.28 as follows:

(110 ILCS 805/3-29.28 new)

_Sec. 3-29.28. Use of artificial intelligence in instruction._

_(a) As used in this Section, "artificial intelligence" has the same meaning
given to the term in Section 2-101 of the Illinois Human Rights Act._

_(b) Each board shall require the faculty member who teaches a course to be an
individual who meets the qualifications set forth in 23 Ill. Adm. Code
1501.303(f) and any other applicable rules adopted by the State Board. A
course may not, in lieu of a faculty member, use artificial intelligence as
the sole source of instruction for students._

_(c) Nothing in this Section shall be construed to prohibit a faculty member
from using artificial intelligence to augment course instruction._
